skill.name: claude-reflect
skill.description: Self-learning system that captures corrections during sessions and reminds users to run /reflect to update CLAUDE.md. Use when discussing learnings, corrections, or when the user mentions remembering something for future sessions.
skill.summary: Self-learning system that captures corrections during sessions and reminds users to run /reflect to ...
skill.author: BayramAnnakov

security_audit.summary: Legitimate self-learning system with minimal risk profile. All code execution is self-contained and serves the stated purpose of capturing user corrections. No network calls, no credential access, no data exfiltration.

low_findings.title: Subprocess execution for AI analysis
low_findings.description: The semantic_detector.py script uses subprocess.run() to call `claude -p` for AI-powered semantic analysis of user messages. This is legitimate functionality for the skill's purpose but involves spawning external processes.

content.user_title: Build persistent AI memory from corrections
content.value_statement: Claude Code forgets lessons between sessions. This skill automatically captures corrections and preferences, then helps you build permanent CLAUDE.md documentation so Claude remembers your preferences across all future sessions.
actual_capabilities: Automatically detects correction patterns in user messages (no, use X, actually, remember:, etc.)
Queues captured learnings to ~/.claude/learnings-queue.json for review
Scans historical session files for missed corrections when running /reflect --scan-history
Validates learnings with semantic AI analysis to filter false positives
Updates CLAUDE.md and AGENTS.md files with approved learnings after human review
Detects and suggests guidelines for repeated tool execution errors
limitations: Requires human review - learnings are not automatically added to CLAUDE.md
Only works with Claude Code sessions - does not capture from other AI tools
Cannot modify code or execute commands outside the reflection workflow
Does not learn from successful actions - only captures explicit corrections

use_cases.title: Remember model preferences
use_cases.description: Capture corrections like 'use gpt-5.1 not gpt-5 for reasoning' so Claude Code remembers your model preferences across all projects.

use_cases.title: Document project conventions
use_cases.description: Build a CLAUDE.md file that captures coding standards, tool preferences, and project-specific guidelines for your entire team.

use_cases.title: Multi-language correction support
use_cases.description: Works in any language - captures corrections in Russian, Spanish, German, and other languages with semantic AI validation.

prompt_templates.title: Capture a quick correction
prompt_templates.prompt: no, use Python not JavaScript for this task

prompt_templates.title: Explicit learning request
prompt_templates.scenario: When you want to remember something important
prompt_templates.prompt: remember: always check DATABASE_URL in .env before connecting to PostgreSQL

output_examples.input: User runs /reflect after corrections were captured
output: 1. Use gpt-5.1 for reasoning tasks | global | new
2. Check DATABASE_URL in .env for PostgreSQL | project | new

best_practices: Use 'remember:' prefix for high-confidence learnings that should never be missed
Run /reflect --scan-history when setting up on a new machine to import past corrections
Apply learnings with appropriate scope - global for model preferences, project for specific conventions
anti_patterns: One-time task instructions are not reusable learnings and will be filtered out
Corrections that are highly context-specific may not be useful across sessions
Not reviewing learnings before applying can lead to noisy CLAUDE.md files

faq.question: Does this skill work on Windows?
faq.answer: Yes. Version 2.0+ uses native Python scripts and works on Windows without WSL.

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: All languages. Semantic AI detection works in any language, not just English patterns.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All data stays local. No network calls except to Claude CLI for semantic analysis.

faq.question: Why was my correction not captured?
faq.answer: Corrections must match detection patterns or be explicitly marked with 'remember:'. Run /reflect --scan-history to find missed corrections.

faq.question: How is this different from other memory skills?
faq.answer: Focuses on capturing corrections, not general context. Requires human review before adding to CLAUDE.md.
